titles.title: A bill to amend title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act to establish requirements with respect to prescription drug benefits.
A bill to amend title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act to establish requirements with respect to prescription drug benefits.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary: This bill prohibits health insurers and contracted entities that provide pharmacy benefits management services from receiving a price reduction or other remuneration from prescription drug manufacturers. The prohibition does not apply if (1) the price reduction is reflected at the point-of-sale; and (2) the other remuneration is a transparent, flat service fee that the manufacturer pays in relation to pharmacy benefits management services.
